name: Monitor Competitors & Generate Content Ideas with GPT4 & Gemini to Google Sheets

user.name: Shelly-Ann Davy
user.bio:
Founder of The Workflow Muse & @SheCodesFlow.

I craft elegant, task-focused automations for creators, founders, and soft-tech enthusiasts.

‚ÄúAutomate with grace. Scale with power.‚Äù

description:
## Who‚Äôs it for
Women creators, homemakers-turned-entrepreneurs, and feminine lifestyle brands who want a graceful, low-lift way to keep an eye on competitor content and spark weekly ideas.

## What it does
On a weekly schedule, this workflow crawls your competitor URLs with **Firecrawl** (HTTP Request), summarizes each page with **OpenAI**, brainstorms carousel/pin ideas with **Gemini**, appends results to **Google Sheets** (Date, URL, Title, Summary, Ideas), and sends you a single email digest (optional Telegram alert). It includes basic error notifications and a setup-friendly config node.

## Requirements
- **HTTP credentials** for Firecrawl, OpenAI, and Gemini (no keys in nodes)
- **Google Sheets** OAuth credential
- A Sheets document with a target sheet/range (e.g., `Digest!A:F`)
- (Optional) Telegram bot + chat ID

## How to set up
1. Open **Set: Configuration (edit me)** and fill:
   - `competitorUrls` (one per line), `sheetsSpreadsheetId`, `sheetsRange`,
     `ownerEmail`, `emailTo`, `geminiModel`, `openaiModel`
2. Attach credentials to the HTTP and Sheets nodes.
3. Test by switching **Cron** to **Every minute**, then revert to weekly.

## How it works
Cron ‚Üí Firecrawl (per URL) ‚Üí Normalize ‚Üí OpenAI (summary) + Gemini (ideas) ‚Üí Merge ‚Üí Compile Row ‚Üí Google Sheets append ‚Üí Build one digest ‚Üí Email (+ optional Telegram).

## How to customize
- Add/remove competitors or change the weekly send time.
- Tweak the OpenAI/Gemini prompts for your brand voice.
- Expand columns in Sheets (e.g., category, tone, CTA).
- Swap email/Telegram for Slack/Notion, or add persistent logs.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

workflow.name: Weekly creator competitor ideas to Google Sheets (Firecrawl + AI)

parameters.content:
## Who‚Äôs it for
Elegant creators and women-led brands who want a graceful, low-lift way to watch competitors weekly.

## What it does
- Runs weekly on a schedule
- Crawls competitor URLs with **Firecrawl** (HTTP Request)
- Summarizes with **OpenAI** and ideates titles with **Gemini**
- Appends Date, URL, Title, Summary, Ideas to **Google Sheets**
- Emails a single digest (optional Telegram alert)

## Requirements
- HTTP credentials for Firecrawl, OpenAI, Gemini (no keys in nodes)
- Google Sheets OAuth credential
- (Optional) Telegram bot + chat ID

## How to set up
1) Open **Set: Configuration (edit me)** and fill fields (emails, sheet ID/range, competitor URLs).
2) Attach credentials to HTTP & Sheets nodes.
3) Test with Cron set to **Every minute**, then revert to weekly.

## Submission checklist
üìí Sticky notes present (this + README)

üîê No hardcoded API keys (attach credentials to HTTP nodes)

üìù Markdown with `##` H2 headings (no HTML tags)

üö´ Original work (no reposting/stealing)

nodes.name: HTTP: Firecrawl Scrape
nodes.notes: Attach Header Auth credential: Authorization: Bearer <FIRECRAWL_KEY>

nodes.name: HTTP: OpenAI Summarize
nodes.notes: Attach Header Auth credential: Authorization: Bearer <OPENAI_API_KEY>

nodes.name: HTTP: Gemini Ideas
nodes.notes: Attach API key via credentials (no keys in JSON).

parameters.subject: Elegant Weekly Competitor Inspo Digest

nodes.name: Catch: Error Handling
nodes.notes: Receives error outputs from HTTP nodes; forwards to error email.

parameters.content:
## Credentials to attach
- **HTTP: Firecrawl** ‚Üí Header auth: `Authorization: Bearer <FIRECRAWL_KEY>`
- **HTTP: OpenAI** ‚Üí Header auth: `Authorization: Bearer <OPENAI_API_KEY>`
- **HTTP: Gemini** ‚Üí API key via credentials (header or query `key=...`)
- **Google Sheets: Append** ‚Üí Google Sheets OAuth credential
- **Email: Send Digest** ‚Üí SMTP credential
- **Email: Error Notification** ‚Üí SMTP credential
- **(Optional) Telegram** ‚Üí Bot token (Telegram node credential) + `telegramChatId`

**Note:** Keep credentials empty in the JSON you submit. Users attach their own after import.
